title: ENCORE ET ENCORE blocage logiciel si mauvais m d passe d'un compte mail
creator: st.magnin
content: Bonjour à tous et toutes, Je ne dois pas être le seul à demander ou redemander, cette question auquelle je ne trouve pas une seule solution éventuellement proposée, qui règle le souci Explication J'ai donc thunderbird avec 5 comptes de mails d'opérateurs différents dont, l'emmerdeur FREE En effet, en plus du logiciel, j'ai un vpn sur mon pc et mon mobile pour le travail et autres Si par malheur j'interroge mon mail free avec mon vpn actif soit sur pc ou sur le mobile, tout se passe correctement mais trés rapidement dans la nuit cet emmerdeur de free bloque mon mail, annule le mot de passe car il a détecté le MAL !!! et bloque toutAlors les ennuis commencent avec thunderbird Je m'arrache les cheveux, car à peine déclencher evidemment il interroge free et là !! bim !!! refusé ! et c'est le caca !! la fenêtre de connexion pour free, n'arrête pas de revenir bloquant tout, tout !! tant qu'il n'aura pas un bon m d passe ! et je ne veux pas supprimer le compte mail pour débloquer, car cela fou la merde avec tous mes dossiers de mails free enregistrés dans thunderbird , et c'est pénible de tout remettre et relancer et reconfigurer comme on le souhaite Je voudrais savoir pour les ingénieurs et leurs grandes antennes de thunderbird, ne font rien pour ce souci a priori réccurent et connu On m'a dit de décocher des cases pour essayer de "sauter" free mais aucune solution ne fonctionne C'est une vraie plaie à l'appréciation de ce logiciel. Alors svp une vraie réponse de pro claire façon tuto et fonctionnelle svp pitié !!

title: New account same email OR reconnecting Local folders after switching hosting providers
creator: jennifer22
content:
Hi. I recently had to change email providers and at first chose Proton but had to change again for reasons. Before I moved to proton, I shifted a whack of email to local folders on the advice of someone. I backed up my profile folder before making the move to proton, but didn't realise (I know, 'duh') that local folders didn't move. It wasn't untill I moved again that the local folders in the new install were empty.

All 3 accounts—original, proton & new—had the same email account name/domain but I want to know how I could create another instance of it to port all my old email from the original service—which has all the email still in their original folders (not local) so I have them 'non-local' again and can go through and organize them anew.

The alternative is to connect the local folders to this new instance but I'd rather the first scenario.

I'll only still have access to all 3 providers for another couple of weeks so this is feeling urgent.

Any help/suggestions most welcome. Thanks!

title: Plus Addressing
creator: markfilipak
content:
Does TBird support plus addressing?

Scenario: I want to reply to email sent "To: markfilipak+joe@...". To do that successfully, in the "Write" dialog, I have to click on "From", scroll down to "Customize From Address...", click it, and add "+joe". (There is a menu alternative: "Options","Customize From Address...".)

If I forget to do that, then my reply does not have "+joe"; it goes out "From: markfilipak@...".

The Issue: When Joe replies to _that_ message, it does not have "+joe", so Joe's reply is trashed. (It's trashed because a filter I wrote automatically deletes messages that do not have "To: markfilipak+<something>@..." in the header.

The sensible way to handle plus addressing is for TBird to recognize plus addressing and to automatically make my "From" header from Joe's "To" header. That way, "+joe" will always be there.

Is there a way to do that?

Thanks Folks! -- Mark.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0;os:Linux Mint

title: Veel ongewenste berichten ontvangen.
creator: johansikkema
content:
Goede morgen, Vanaf 20 januari 2026 ontvang ik ongewenste meldingen, bijvoorbeeld "MIJN ZIGGO, laatste waarschuwing, uw account wordt gedeactiveerd". Inmiddels zijn het 38 meldingen. Thunderbird waarschuwt wel: Denkt dat dit bericht ongewenst is. Daarboven staan een aantal mogelijkheden: Beantwoorden, Doorsturen, Archiveren, Ongewenst, Verwijderen en Meer. Dan is het vreemd, dat "Ongewenst" als enige niet donker is, zodat ik deze mogelijkheid niet aan kan klikken. Dat los ik op door "Verplaatsen" te kiezen en op te slaan in de map "Ongewenst". Daardoor weet ik nu dat het er inmiddels 38 meldingen zijn. Op 27 januari 7x.

Het zijn steeds verschillende afzenders, twee voorbeelden: "dredx@sccheats.co.uk" en "tyrakel.de". Uiteraard klik ik niet verder aan! Hebben jullie een oplossing voor mij?

Met vriendelijke groet, Johan Sikkema

privacygevoelige gegevens verwijderd
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0

title: Can I use TB to store all old email which I want to delete from server?
creator: xiiip11
content:
Hi all. My mail account reached 50 GB (it's too much) and this is what I plan to do:

1) Download all emails to TB 2) Remove emails older then 1 year from server (for now I don't know how to do that) 3) Keep all emails in TB and use it as my local database - if I'm looking for some old mails then I will go to TB

Important information - daily I don't use TB. I log to my mail via web gui.

The question is - what TB will do when it connects to server and notices that older emails are deleted. Will TB also delete them locally? It's not what I want - my goal is to keep old emails locally. Should I disconnect TB from server after downloading all email by changing credentials?

Please tell me what you think about that plan. Do you see better way to store old emails and keep mailbox slim on the server? I want to fit in 2-5 GB.

By the way do you have idea how to delete mails older then 1 year from server? I have shell access.

title: Thunderbird Account
creator: pasqualester
content:
Hello, I have two microsoft email addresses linked to Thunderbird, one @hotmail.com and one @outlook.com. I have been using Thunderbird with them both fine for some time. Recently, the outlook.com account has stopped sending emails via Thunderbird. As far as I can tell, this was out of nowhere, and I hadn't changed any settings. It still receives emails.

Both accounts use the same SMTP information, and the hotmail.com continues to work with those details.

I have tried changing the settings and even deleting and readding the account but it hasn't fixed it. I have also checked the outlook account is still IMAP and POP enabled and it is.

When I do try and send an email, I am told: "Login to server smtp.office365.com with username [edited]@outlook.com failed. with options to Retry, Enter New Password (which loads a new window briefly but then disappears) and Cancel."

When I cancel, I get this message: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again."

My server settings, on both accounts, are: smtp.office365.com Port 587 STARTTLS OAuth2 And the user name matches the email.

Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong, and how I could fix it? Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 11
